<p>
Ashwin bowled an amazing spell along with Jadeja. He could have gotten another wicket if Tamim's catch wasn't dropped. On such turning tracks Ashwin should only bowl a single over in the powerplay and the remaining 3 overs should be used between overs 8-20 as the ball generally spins much more as it gets older and the pitch takes more turn. Nehra needs to bowl 3 overs upfront as he does not seem to be able to nail yorkers at the death. With Bumrah its the direct opposite. It would work wonders for the Indian team if he is given only 1 over in the powerplay and 3 overs at the death.
</p>
</p>, <p>
Ashwin bowled an amazing spell along with Jadeja. He could have gotten another wicket if Tamim's catch wasn't dropped. On such turning tracks Ashwin should only bowl a single over in the powerplay and the remaining 3 overs should be used between overs 8-20 as the ball generally spins much more as it gets older and the pitch takes more turn. Nehra needs to bowl 3 overs upfront as he does not seem to be able to nail yorkers at the death. With Bumrah its the direct opposite. It would work wonders for the Indian team if he is given only 1 over in the powerplay and 3 overs at the death.
</p>, <p>
<p>
Cricket is a multi-dimensional sport where outcomes of matches aren't determined only by batting &amp; bowling performances of competing teams. IND are much stronger team than BD. But victories are secured by converting potential into performances &amp; minimising errors. IND had put a defendable score in the match though BD fielded well. IND should have won the match by about 20/30 runs but for 2 crucial dropped catches &amp; ground fielding errors. Match situation then shifted in favour of BD. BD with persistent positive batting &amp; left-right combination limited effectiveness of IND spinners. In the end BD should have won the match but made tactical batting errors in last over. It was significant for IND that young players (Bumrah &amp; Pandya ) after initial errors showed great resilience to play a crucial role in defending the total in end overs.  MSD unlike many captains wasn't critical on the field that would have demoralised the youngsters. As per cricketing logic Pandya deserved the MOM.
</p>
</p>, <p>
Cricket is a multi-dimensional sport where outcomes of matches aren't determined only by batting &amp; bowling performances of competing teams. IND are much stronger team than BD. But victories are secured by converting potential into performances &amp; minimising errors. IND had put a defendable score in the match though BD fielded well. IND should have won the match by about 20/30 runs but for 2 crucial dropped catches &amp; ground fielding errors. Match situation then shifted in favour of BD. BD with persistent positive batting &amp; left-right combination limited effectiveness of IND spinners. In the end BD should have won the match but made tactical batting errors in last over. It was significant for IND that young players (Bumrah &amp; Pandya ) after initial errors showed great resilience to play a crucial role in defending the total in end overs.  MSD unlike many captains wasn't critical on the field that would have demoralised the youngsters. As per cricketing logic Pandya deserved the MOM.

India fielded very poorly in the match. Tamim, Sarkar and Shakib were all dropped off of relatively easy chances and misfielding a few boundaries costing us around 40 runs and an easy victory. In contrast Bangladesh fielded brilliantly saving at least 10-15 runs in the field and Soumya Sarkar's brilliant catch of Hardik pandya was the turning point in our batting innings. Dhoni could have used an extra spinner on such a pitch. Harbhajan could have been as deadly as Ashwin and Jadeja on this pitch. We need to learn a thing or two from New Zealand who have dropped 2 of their best fast bowlers in Boult and Southee to get in the extra spinners in Sodhi and Santner who have been amazing for them.

Though these contributions may not be sufficient to beat aussies. A couple of batsmen has to fire big way, if we have to beat the aussies. Aus strength is that they have 3 pure batsmen Khwaja, warner &amp; smith and four all rounders Watson, Faulkner, Maxwell, Marsh. All these 4 can do big hitting as well as take care of 10 overs between them which would reduce the pressure on the 3 frontline bowlers. - Nile, hastings &amp; Zampa. If we bat first and post less than 160, it wud be within the reach of these all rounders, as there is a possibility that one of them may fire big. Perhaps we may replace Yuvi with Negi, as Yuvi has not been bowling. result of Pak Aus match is irrelevant to us, given the fact our NRR is very low. Kohli for some reason looked restless during his innings against BD. Hope he gets back to his usual self against the aussies.

India was lucky to win. No doubt about that. But Bangladesh were even luckier to reach  to a stage where they could win. India were lacklustre with both bat and ball (barring a few moments of brilliance). It was similar to how Australia played against Bangladesh last game. If India had played to their potential, Bangladesh had no chance to even get close. The pitch was difficult to bat on. It could be seen by the number of chances that went begging during the Bangladesh innings. If any one of the four catches dropped, were taken, the game would have been done and dusted long time back. I could feel that India were under a lot of pressure and they were very cautious with their approach. On the other hand Bangladesh played freely without any burden. This and the last game against Australia were for Bangladesh's to win. But if you cannot win when your opponents aren't at their best, I don't know when will you win.

I think it's extremely unfortunate that we are calling for the heads of the players representing our country. We won for God Sake. Least we forget  that Pakistan has never beaten us in a World Cup Game. Even Australia doesn't have that record. Bangladesh hasn't beaten us in a T20 ever. Rank turners only go against us when the opposition has Off-Spinners Nathan Lyon, Ajmal during his hay days, Saqlain, Moen Ali. Zampa looks like a good prospect for Australia and Maxwell is a part timer at best. Yes, basis our current form we definitely not contenders, we all agree. But now is the time to stand behind the team. We've won 12 out of 14 T20 matches. It would very surprising if other nations treated their own like the way we do? What more can one expect. Humility at the time of success comes with success. I think the Indian team is humble enough to admit that they need to do more. There is always room to improve, it's a constant process but apologies The flack is definitely uncalled for. If you're an Indian supporter stand behind the time, speak about tactics, support the team on the way forward.  I think that's something we need to learn from our Bangladeshi friends. Even though their team loses more than they win, they support them to the hilt. Strength in numbers people...

Dhoni's calmness is incomparable even to any of the calmest of captains this game has seen, like, steve waugh, richards, Hansie cronje, Ranatunga etc. Only insecured persons will shout out of minds during victories as they think they dont deserve it. Even after winning as many world cups. this guy is all calmness.
You can get another Sachin/Akram/Lara/warne but can never get another Dhoni in cricket
The way he said 'Out' after that last ball without too much emotion or spice shows what this man is upto. Fans of other countries should just admire and enjoy such games, learn the life lesson of composure of players like Dhoni, instead of claiming 'luck' etc. Finally almost everyone is forgetting the role played by Nehra in this game. He mentored every bowler and also guided Dhoni all the way through and that is why Dhoni respects him so much. Its either India or Australia who will win this world cup from her.
</p>

Even after winning as many world cups. this guy is all calmness.
You can get another Sachin/Akram/Lara/warne but can never get another Dhoni in cricket
The way he said 'Out' after that last ball without too much emotion or spice shows what this man is upto. Fans of other countries should just admire and enjoy such games, learn the life lesson of composure of players like Dhoni, instead of claiming 'luck' etc. Finally almost everyone is forgetting the role played by Nehra in this game. <p>
Coming to the match itself. I think the real man of thr match has to br Dhoni - and by huge margin. The way he maintained his composure and ralkied his troops along was phenomenal! 4 things stood out for me: (1) Creating that stumping out of no where, it was nothing short of miracle (2) Getting Ashwin to bowl that over instead of getting a part timer to do, and thereby effecting Shakib disnissal (3) Giving confidence to Bumrah and Pandya for the last 2 overs and nurturing them along, and finally (4) for that run out in the end - collecting without one glove, running in with pads on, having confidence to outrun a fresh pair of legs with a headstart and to top it all that cool confident reassuring smile to say Out, while we all were holding our breaths for the side on replay! Hats off to the man!! As someone said, there could be another Sachin, another Lara or another Warne, but there could be only one Dhoni! Salute.
</p>

The way he maintained his composure and ralkied his troops along was phenomenal! 4 things stood out for me: (1) Creating that stumping out of no where, it was nothing short of miracle (2) Getting Ashwin to bowl that over instead of getting a part timer to do, and thereby effecting Shakib disnissal (3) Giving confidence to Bumrah and Pandya for the last 2 overs and nurturing them along, and finally (4) for that run out in the end - collecting without one glove, running in with pads on, having confidence to outrun a fresh pair of legs with a headstart and to top it all that cool confident reassuring smile to say Out, while we all were holding our breaths for the side on replay! Pandya is no good and does not inspire confidence unlike Bumrah who had a horrendous match conceding a boundary,dropping Tamim's sitter off Ashwin and conceding 16 in the last Power-play over.But he made amends by conceding only 6 in the penultimate over thereby erasing the impact of the last ball four off Nehra's last ball in the 18th over. 2 boundaries in 2 balls even considering Rahim's successful lap sweep show the Bangladesh keeper's field and match awareness and displays Pandya in poor light. Remember Raina celebrating prematurely in a T20I in Australia in January and a similar reaction by Rahim to consecutive boundaries caused the lapse in concentration that led to his dismissal and opened the doors for an Indian win. Mahmudullah's needless hoick superbly caught by Jadeja was the icing on the cake and MSD running out Mustafizur(India's tormentor in the ODI series in Bangladesh in June last year) to secure a narrow 1 run win was poetic justice after India's poor fielding effort.

I am not sure as why Rahane was selected when india had better T20 batsman in form of Manish Panday. Rahane should focus only for test cricket. He has been given so many chances and never proved his credentials with any strong match winning performance. Definitely, Pandya isn't suited for spin friendly pitch and Harbhajan was better choice for this match but Dhoni keeps going his own way and style. He would have been critisized if India had lost this match. Dhoni isn't good in good utilization of resources but going with same warhorse. So, rest of matches, it will be same team no matter what.
</p>

<p>
The turnaround for India started when Bumrah, who earlier had to endure a bad day on the field, bowled those wonderful yorkers in the 17th over and then complemented it with similar efforts in the 19th over of Bangladesh innings. The catches by Kohli, Dhawan, and Jadeja towards the end and Dhoni's intelligence in running out the batsman in the last delivery of the match sealed the match in India's favor. Having said that, with just two runs needed of three balls, Bangladeshi batsmen really blew it with a rare piece of unthinking cricket in the last over of their innings. To Team India's credit, they held their nerves, executed their strategies well in the final stages, and richly deserved the win.
</p>
</p>, <p>

Other than helping a clean slate against BD this win did not do much in advancing India's cause towards getting semifinals spot only because there is no planned assault to increase the NRR

<p>
For India it is a very simple equation now - they cannot qualify unless they beat Australia. Assuming there is a result in the PAK vs AUS match, this will put one of those teams equal on points with India, but above India on NRR. Therefore, anything but a win in the final pool watch will mean elimination for India. The result of the PAK vs AUS match is important to Pakistan - they also must win that match to have a chance of qualifying because then they will finish on 4 points and a loss will mean elimination. Australia, on the other hand, can still lose to Pakistan and it will then all come down to their final match against India. However, they must avoid losing to Pakistan by a large margin or they will need to win big over India to overtake Pakistan on NRR.
</p>
</p>, <p>

Assuming there is a result in the PAK vs AUS match, this will put one of those teams equal on points with India, but above India on NRR. Australia, on the other hand, can still lose to Pakistan and it will then all come down to their final match against India. However, they must avoid losing to Pakistan by a large margin or they will need to win big over India to overtake Pakistan on NRR.

<p>
Great brand of cricket, the best of the tournament so far I guess. Probably the thought process of Bangladeshi batsmen was right. A desparate approach appropriately  at the beginning of 20th over brought them that close....logically they wanted to avoid the desparate situation needing 2/3 from last ball. I dont think it was heroics.  When you get  full tosses on 4rth or 5th ball should never wait for the next ball. 6th ball, as was proved in this case was the best ball of the over. As batsman you never want to leave it for next ball because you dont know whats coming next. I think that was the plan...sadly did not work. Best thing is they never thought of leveling the score with a cautious approach. It was way more than loosing...no less than winning. proud of the tigers and their brave brand of cricket. Well done India and cool old leader Dhoni. lucky though!
</p>

When aussies won the world cup semifinals against south Afric after the match was tied everyone said aussies were brilliant and fought till the last ball was bowled. When dhoni's India did that against Bangladesh and too with 1 run on hand it is termed as 'luck'. When other teams win a closely fought game it is hyped very much and India does it it is insulted. Anyhow Well done India.  You have done us proud especially the presence of mind of Dhoni in removing his right glove. How many captains or wicketkeepers would have done this?  But there are still some sore points in his captaincy like persisting with yuvi and dhawan and raina.  India lost golden opportunity to nurture youngsters like Shareya Iyer Manish pandey etc who were not even selected due to India's perseverance with dhawan raina and yuvi. I don't think it will be an easy climb for Dhoni from now on with this team

<p>
BD is lucky to have lost it by only one run. Remember the misfield by Bumrah on the first ball of BD innings, when he allowed the ball to go for four, when it should have been only one run. That is three extra lucky runs for BD. Then again Bumrah should have held that dolly of a catch of Tamim when he was only on 18. Tamim went on to make 35, which is 17 extra runs! Therefore, if luck had not favoured BD at crucial moments, they would have lost by at least 17+3=20 runs. And I have not included the extra runs which the catch dropped by Ashwin cost India. So luck favoured BD more than India in this match. Dhoni, at least had the presence of mind to run to the wicket to run out the batsmen. That is hard work, and certainly not luck. What was the need for BD players to try to hit sixes when they needed only 2 runs from 3 balls?
</p>

<p>
Bangladesh under Mashrafe look very ominous and improved especially between the ears. They seem to have the self-belief to win against better teams. The way they kept coming at the Ind bowlers is proof that they were not going to back down. So kudos to them for the quality of cricket and tactics when bowling. Chopped off scoring options for Rohit &amp; Dhawan who were just one-dimensional and brainless to counter or come up with Plan B. Blindly hitting out ,these days even minnows don't do that. OTOH Dhoni was a complete contrast,showed no appetite for new tactics.Same team same liabilities and non-performers who thrust the whole responsibility on a couple of players to bail them out. Raina even with 30+ looked scratchy and does not inspire confidence at such a key position. Yuvraj sadly failed after a valuable knock against Pak. Something else is bothering him because if its touch he's played 12 games to have gotten it back. Hats off to Bumrah for coming back after initial disaster.
</p>

Slow turners have not helped India, as our batsmen struggled to score runs. I felt MSD was the man of the match, rather than ashwin. I am a little bit surprised why Yuvi has not been called up to bowl in the middle overs, which wud have given better options to him in the end overs. But then mSD knows better than any other former captains or the experts / analysts, having captained India for so many years and matches in all formats. Hope India will beat aus and go thru to SF. All the best

The Indian openers are really messing up things for middle order. The super slow starts they give in power plays and then throwing away their wickets is putting pressure on middle and lower middle order to accelerate score ! I would rather send Pandya to open be it pinch hitting or what ever. The fielding was pathetic. There were mis-fields and awful number of dropped catches ! Indian team certainly do not deserve the cup on comparing with NZ, WI by the way they are progressing in the tournament. There is no consistency in Rohit Sharma, Raina, Shikhar Dhawan's batting performance. Rohit needs to keep his head still and focus on batting and try to be consistent . Ashwin need to stop talking big and being overconfident at press and concentrate on fielding and bowling ! Yuvi needs to take some responsibility and respect his wicket as he is known for finishing game well if he is set at crease for a while.

<p>
Bangladesh played a very good game and deserved a win here, as they were in control for most of the match. They were winning till the last three balls. They planned well and executed well (very well in bowling). The Indian batsmen lost their wickets when they went for big shots (big swings). The ball was sticking to the pitch and Bangladesh served excellent and well disguised slow balls. On this wicket, you need to wait for the ball and place it preferably with ground strokes. Bowling first worked out well for Bangladesh. India were poor in tactics and execution again, they really did not deserve to win this match with the way they played. As said after the last India match, Kohli will not be delivering every match (in T20s you can only count on it so much, in this series our most consistent batsman could only deliver one out of three matches). I feel Indian batsmen have been trying too hard this series, losing their calm and making too many mistake.

BD fans commenting on India's victory as "luck" should see the amount of dropped catches and "life"s BD team got during the match and analyse for themselves who were lucky ? BD would have been short of atleast 10 to 15 runs had those catches been taken ! Dhoni and entire team's presence of mind, cool head, pressure handling abilities at the end of the match earned us the victory and not luck. Dhoni removed his right hand glove at the last ball of the match that made him not to fumble when he collected the ball at pressure situation and hold the ball and hit the stumps. It is these kind of things that makes champion player. BD were lucky with wild hitting. When they needed 2 off 3 balls all they needed to do was to get single and level score and then go for big shot ! The lack of this  experience is what differentiated between India and BD. What BD batsmen need to learn is "dancing down the track" is not the only way to play aggressive shots ! There is something called "stand n deliver"

Lot of people are saying that Dhoni's captain ship win the match, but actually he was the one who created the situation.. right from team selection, the way he used the bowlers and choice of bowlers made things worse for India. But it is his keeping skill that helped us to win the match - The stunning stumping showed his sharpness and presence of mind and the last ball run out, he did it in his own style. It was a fight between Dhoni's CaptainShip and Keeping skills and the later won. Sorry BD. Better luck next time.
</p>
</p>, <p>

605 comments on here at ~ 1600 Central US time and 35 on the ENG-AFG board. Yep that is about right. There is no denying the gravity pull of the centre of the cricket universe I guess. I would say at least now IND controls its destiny. Beat Oz and they are in. No need to worry about NRR if they do that. Lose to Oz and the winner between Oz and PAK is in. I'm expecting Australia to thump PAK. I think they just match up too well with them. NZ vs. BAN is irrelevant and perhaps based on who is going to be seeded where in the other group a good chance for my lot to "rest some players". You would have to believe NZ would love to play England in the SF over either of SA or WI. But for the poms to get the 1 seed they would have to absolutely maul SL. International tournament T20 is so much more palatable than the franchise/bilateral stuff for a test snob like me. You couldn't have scripted todays finish no matter how hard you tried. There are roads in the Urals with fewer twists and turns.

605 comments on here at ~ 1600 Central US time and 35 on the ENG-AFG board. Yep that is about right. There is no denying the gravity pull of the centre of the cricket universe I guess. I would say at least now IND controls its destiny. Beat Oz and they are in. No need to worry about NRR if they do that. Lose to Oz and the winner between Oz and PAK is in. <p>
BD were exceptional for 39.3 overs today. Immaculate fielding, bowling, field placements, batting - EVERYTHING. If they did not have the brain fade in the last 3 balls, this was their match. Indian fielding was NOT as good as it generally is. Their bowling and batting were as usual - nothing extra ordinary. It is their poor fielding that nearly cost them the match. They dropped two sitters, two difficult catches and one impossible one! Also, India misfielded a single to FOUR. Although I am an Indian, I am sorry for the BD fans. They really deserved to see their team win today. But they can be proud that their team can not be considered underdogs anymore.
</p>

You can get another Sachin/Akram/Lara/warne but can never get another Dhoni
in cricket
</p>
<p>
The way he said 'Out' after that last ball without too much emotion or spice shows what this man is upto. Fans of other countries (including my fella SL fans) should just admire and enjoy such games, learn the life lesson of composure of players like Dhoni, instead of claiming 'luck' etc.
Finally almost everyone is forgetting the role played by Nehra in this game. He mentored every bowler and also guided Dhoni all the way through and that is why Dhoni respects him so much.
Its either India or Australia who will win this world cup from her.
</p>
<p>
-Kushal Veeerarathne

<p>
Best position for pinch hitter is no.3 and that's where Pandya, Ranchi Rhino, Jadeja, Ashwin should bat. If pinch hitter is successful V.Kohli is presented an opportunity to take the score to 200+ and if pinch hitter is un-succesful V.Kohli knows how to bat in usual manner. Considering pitch, not allowing Yuvraj or Rohit Sharma to bowl was not a wise decision. In future matches, if pitch requires, then Harbhajan could be included in place of Shikhar Dhawan and Pandya or Jadeja could be asked to open. This may sound strange, but pitches on which India has played have been very bad and no one knows how many times Indian team will be lucky. Pandya with ball in this match, reminds of Hrishikesh Kanitkar with bat in Dhaka in 1998 .
</p>

Indian cricket team has been winning in recent past mostly because of accurate bowling and this close win against BAN does not surprise me at all. In twenty twenty cricket at least one batsman has to score in blitzkrieg manner like ABD, Gayle, Root, Maxwell are scoring. When was the last time Indian batsmen were comfortable and scored freely ? Has any Indian batsman scored twenty ball fifty in this world cup ? India could have easily won the match against NZ, if at least two batsmen had scored quick thirties and remaining batsmen just gathered around them. And what to say of Indian pitches, they are worst pitches team can ever find.

<p>
Its takes an MS to hit out the match ... Probably the crucial question that the entire B'desh team should have asked themselves is exactly that... "Should I hit India out of the park... Or should I work the ball around and play safe?". Its not a fluke that MS hits amazing shots in the death and does it in style.. Its a testament to his experience and sheer discipline and not just swinging the bat at anything and everything without regard to the situation of the match and the win equation at the pertinent point of time.... B'desh (right from Tamin to Mahmadullah) tried to rush the issue and the results were disastrous... Experience pays at the end of the day boys and girls. Perhaps its time the Kids next door understand that.
</p>

<p>
Bad luck BD and congratulations on getting out of jail India. BD deserved the win but went for the big shot once too often. Feel sorry for Masrafi and his team who out played India on the field and tactically. India was lucky to say the least. The umpiring standards at this T20 WC continue to be poor when it comes to LBWs. Dhawan was clearly out LBW in the third over (on 8 runs) but was not given out. He was eventually given out at the end of the sixth over (on 22 runs). The runs Dhawan scored between the third and sixth over alone (14 runs) would have been enough to win the game for BD. It only takes one poor decision to turn the game. Why not use DRS in T20? We use DRS in the ODI world cup and in test cricket. Is T20 somehow less important? I hope the T20 WC is not decided by umpiring error!
</p>

Heartwrenching defeat for BD . The nation is in mourning as l am. After playing for so long l had expected their maturity to carry them through after the brilliant fielding and bowling against India to contain them at the sub par score of less than 150.  So who is to blame? What happened. Maybe it was bad luck. But a few issues I'd like to share. Picking mithun when there are other experienced veterans was poor selection. Consistently sending Mahmudullah so low down the order made no sense. Mortaza coming in to bat before Mahmudullah made no sense other than to show his antics and penchant for hroics. Both Mahmudullah and mushy leaving the slogging till the last over was too little to late. And someone should've told mustafa to sprint to the other end to tie the score.  Don't know what others feel but these mistakes I feel  cost us the game of a lifetime.
</p>

That too me changed the course of the match and India ended up with less than 150.  If India put a total over 150 then BD have no chance at all, they have never won a match against a good team chasing a big total.

<p>
Michael Vaughan said after the Edgbaston test of 2005 Ashes, the way Australia celebrated every English wicket told a story. For nearly 15 years prior, Australian teams would just turn up, and expect the English to roll over. Similarly, India's celebration and tension summed up Bangladesh's progress as a limited overs' team. India definitely dodged a bullet here. In many ways, Bangladesh bowled better, fielded better, and batted better until 19.3 overs. Gutted as BD might be, hope the scars aren't deep. As for India, props to Dhoni, Bumrah, and Jadeja for their coolth under pressure. But they'd know that they need to scale up a few rungs of performance if they want to beat Australia, let alone get to the semi-finals.
</p>
</p>, <p>
Michael Vaughan said after the Edgbaston test of 2005 Ashes, the way Australia celebrated every English wicket told a story. For nearly 15 years prior, Australian teams would just turn up, and expect the English to roll over. Similarly, India's celebration and tension summed up Bangladesh's progress as a limited overs' team. India definitely dodged a bullet here. In many ways, Bangladesh bowled better, fielded better, and batted better until 19.3 overs. Gutted as BD might be, hope the scars aren't deep. As for India, props to Dhoni, Bumrah, and Jadeja for their coolth under pressure. But they'd know that they need to scale up a few rungs of performance if they want to beat Australia, let alone get to the semi-finals.

And Bangladesh made sure, they did just that. They continued with their losing streak againy India in T20I. <p>
This win will do a world of good to this Indian team.
1. It will reinforce the belief that they can win from any situation
2. Bangladesh made full use of their knowledge of playing Australia in the same ground. They fielded brilliantly and bowled tight. They also won the toss.
3. The key moment , to me was the breath taking catch to dismiss Pandya. Had he stayed for 10 more balls, the match would have been all but over for BD
4. India had a rare bad day in the field. 
5. Hence even though BD planned superbly and executed them almost neatly (with luck seemingly on their side until last 3) to go over the line, there still is a big difference in class between the two sides.
6. The greatness of a side is reflected in their humility, which BD lacks. With all their improvement, I just hope they get rid of their stupid arrogance. It'll do a lot of good to them.

I think India are getting warmed up here. I am sure they now have found their hunger to keep winning games. T20 is a game of momentum and boy did India need this win to keep that going.

<p>
Actually India did not deserve to win although as Indian am relieved. BD had planned very well. They seem to focus so much on beating India. This intensity was lacking against aus and pak though. All this excitement would not have been possible had Rohit Sharma just waited to play out the last ball of the power play.  Indian batting is not good...the openers are struggling on Indian pitches. Raina is not doing good either. In the field India dropped catches and misfielded. Tamim was lucky and got away with rash shots. Tactically BD did very well and bowled beautifully. Similar to how SL planned in the 2014 WC final. But they need to do this with other teams too. For India this match was needed as bumrah, Pandya and even Nehra have not had any pressure so far . In fact recently India have not had a close finish. The match showed up Indias weaknesses and is a wake up call for them. Dhoni must be flexible and select rahane and shami so that opponents can't plan everything. But great game.

<p>
WHAT A MATCH !!! This was looking a lot like the Ind-SA match in WT20-2012 where SA kept hitting big shots and kept getting out but ultimately India won by 1 run &amp; here too India won by the same margin. I think I have never felt this kind of excitement and tension for years. I recall the Ind-Pak WT20 Final in 2007 which was a similar match. Another match I recall is the WC1999 Aus-SA SF where Aus looked out of it in the final over when Damien Martin was hit for 2 4s. Here too Pandya was hit for 2 successive 4s but ultimately kept his cool to help Ind win. A special mention of Jadeja for that terrific catch &amp; another special mention of Bumrah who initially ruined it for India by conceding a 4, dropping a catch, letting a 6 being hit and then going for 4 boundaries in his next over but then showed tenacity to bowl 2 lovely overs.. BD played very well but some poor shots have cost them this match. Ind wanted to improve their NRR but never mind. A win is a win.
</p>

Mushfiqur and Mahmudullah will be regretting this for rest of their lives. Other than the last three freak balls, BD were truly on top. But cricket is all about who can hold their nerves better and India showed why they deserved a win. Pandya and Bumrah are a great find and will continue to rise. For next match, India will have to be far better than this. Specifically, bat better and field better. It may sound strange on a typical day, but their bowling won them this match.
</p>

<p>
With all due respect to Dhoni, I'm still convinced with this win. I know that its easy to be an armchair pundit, but what is the logic of not bowling spinners in the mid overs ? Against NZ on a rank turner, India played only 2 fulltime spinners. Even in the match against Pakistan, spinners bowled 8 overs for 36 runs and 2 wickets vs 10 overs for 77 runs off seamers. Again in today's match, Yuvraj didnt bowl, Raina got only over despite getting a wicket. Pandya got last over although went for 20+ runs off 2 overs. Its good to be creative, but not learning from mistakes is foolish. Hope MS trusts the spinners more against Australia.
</p>

I hope Icc will provide more opportunity to Teams like BD and Afg to play in foreign soil specially in India, Aus, Eng. Good luck to India for the rest of the tournament.

India did not deserve to win that game. Very similar to the WC 1999 Semi final. Bangladesh you have come a long way. Believe that you are already at the top level, and persist with this squad. It has to be one of the most balanced sides in Asia right now: with a great captain like Mash who leads from the front, the best spinning allrounder in the world in Shakib, really good fast bowlers in Mustafiz, Al amin and Taskin, one of the best fielders in Sowmya and one of the best finishers in Riyadh. Mushfiq and Tamim need to be a tad bit more consistent, but this team has the makings of a WC winning side, Imagine if Taskin would have played today, we would not have even managed 146. Our collective hearts go out to you, this is not the time to lose hope. You guys are a great team to watch! - From an Indian fan
</p>

<p>
That was as much luck a team could get and still BD lost. Winning the toss is a big plus on these dodgy wickets. 4 boundaries from Tamim were slogs/mishits and 3 boundaries from Shabbir were complete mishits where even he didnt know where the ball went. That's about 20% of the target in such a low scoring game. I am not counting on the dropped catches because normally I dont consider that as luck as fielding is a skill. Just like staying calm under pressure is a skill and India showed it today. Some more skill/planning - Dhoni removes his glove off the last ball anticipating the bye run, Dhoni swaps the fielders at deep midwicket at 19.5 despite Dhawan taking the catch and has his best fielder there, Dhoni brings on his best bowler at the right time to bowl out to pick up Shakib's wicket, Bumrah bowls 5 yorkers out of 6 balls of the 19th over, Pandya bowls a slower wide length ball anticipating the batsman's set up for yorker off the last ball. India won DESPITE not being lucky
</p>

<p>
It was not luck that won the game for India, but it was the holding their nerves and once again the cool head of msd that sealed it.  I have written comments long back to remove msd from the squad when they were losing odis but man he is the best one that the team can have.  He is way smart, agile and sensible when it comes to stumping.  I don't think any other keeper in this world could have pulled off that stumping of sabbir rahman.  Bangladesh played well and were in control but no offence it was because of those dropped chances.  Tamim dropped on 10 odd runs and in next over he got 16 runs. Same goes with shakib too.  Luck was on bangladesh's side but the COOL HEAD "MSD"was on India's side.  He may have lost his midas touch but hasn't lost his cool &amp; thinking head.  He may be one of the greatest captains but he is the greatest of great keepers of the modern era and cannot be replaced by any one except him. Thank you and sorry MSD its time you lift the cup one last time.
</p>

<p>
This match is the biggest proof for all those last doubters that Dhoni indeed is a genius captain. Real genius. He has won some matches purely by his captaincy. WT20 Ind-Pak tied match where he asked Sreesanth to bowl short from round the wicket to Misbah, the WT20 Final where he used his best bowlers earlier to give Joginder a big enough cushion, and then going opposite to the prev tactic mysteriously holding back spinners asking Ishant to bowl the 17th over in ICC-CT 2013, his sudden self-promotion in WC2011 Final, and his brilliant captaincy + keeping today are signs of the genius of Dhoni. While we thought of Yorkers, Dhoni told Pandya not to bowl a Final Ball Yorker cos a Yorker would have been easy to hit for 1-2 runs to tie/win. He knew a bye would be tried and was ready. I think he was inside the BD batsmen mind. Awesome. And what do we say for the magical stumping of Shabbir? Dhoni's timing was perfect there. All hail the genius of Dhoni..
</p>

Meanwhile I am really worried about this Indian team. The batting seems to be without any plan. Again Rohit needs to play into the gaps, if you have wickets you go berserk at the end. Will be surprised if this team win against the Aussies, leave aside the world cup. I was all for Dhawan and Raina, as they are really impact players and used to play without fear but currently they look all at sea. Again, I felt Dhoni should have bought Yuvraj on to bowl. If you are not going to bowl Yuvraj, then at least get Bhajji into the team. I credit Dhoni though for the brilliant presence of mind, a second to early or a second to late would nor have got him the stumping of the airborne Sabhir, unfortunately for the later. Good game.

<p>
Hello All, today it is not India won the match but Bangladesh lost the match. It might have been their lack of experience, choking or crunch situation what ever it is. India playing like this should not expect to win this world cup though they are keeping their aspirations alive. I'm not going to suggest that there needs to be a team change for them, the current team is very good but today their strongest pursuit 'fielding' has failed them a lot. Their fielding was worst I have seen for years (three dropped catches, misfielding etc). Their batting also let them down a bit today that score was not at all strong enough to defend and no batsman tried to stay and hit through. If they entertain any thoughts of going further and lift the cup they cannot play like this and expect miracles save them. Today purely a miracle and Bangladesh's inexperience in crunch situations saved the match. Kudos to Bangla tigers who woken up a nation with one jolt. Aussies must now be licking their lips.
</p>
</p>, <p>
Hello All, today it is not India won the match but Bangladesh lost the match. It might have been their lack of experience, choking or crunch situation what ever it is. India playing like this should not expect to win this world cup though they are keeping their aspirations alive. I'm not going to suggest that there needs to be a team change for them, the current team is very good but today their strongest pursuit 'fielding' has failed them a lot. Their fielding was worst I have seen for years (three dropped catches, misfielding etc). Their batting also let them down a bit today that score was not at all strong enough to defend and no batsman tried to stay and hit through. If they entertain any thoughts of going further and lift the cup they cannot play like this and expect miracles save them. Today purely a miracle and Bangladesh's inexperience in crunch situations saved the match. Kudos to Bangla tigers who woken up a nation with one jolt. Aussies must now be licking their lips.

<p>
Whoa, what a match it was! Commiserations BD, Congratulations India. That's the beauty of T20 cricket. A team chases 230 quiet comfortably and next match they're in trouble against a relatively inexperienced and weaker side. After posting 146 and a good start by BD, it was only Bangladesh's match to lose. But it's good teams like BD are rising up and giving these long time full sides a run for their money. There's always that element of slight luck that you need in this format and this time it was India's. However, BD can take positives from this game. Putting aside the suspension of their two bowlers, showed tough intent. Their finishers will henceforth not go for glamour hits when the match is easily on your palms. This surely has to go down as one of the most exciting matches and probably the best in this year's edition. Gotta give credit to the curators, there's been a vast variety of pitches offered. High scoring ones, turners, green decks.
</p>

<p>
Congrats India albeit escaped literally by the skin of their teeth to survive in the WC. Pandya was lucky in the 20th over to take 2 wkts + a run out off the last 3 balls - with just I run to tie &amp; 2 runs to win by BD. Never has the luck been so tilted &amp; India has to thank Dame Luck for this Win. A Tie or loss would have eliminated India. Now if India beat Australia in their final match they will qualify. Indian batting was doleful + only 2 bowlers Ashwin &amp; Jadeja bowled to their potential. Bumrah, Nehra &amp; Pandya leaked runs freely. On the whole it was a pathetically poor show vs. a BD team that got blown out by other 3 teams in Gr. B. Indian batting is highly vulnerable against good bowling &amp; their weakness was exposed even by BD. Will Dhoni get a batsman instead of inept Raina / Yuvraj? Dhawan &amp; Rohit are already "Iffy". That leaves a solo bat in Kohli. Playing the same XI irrespective of its short comings &amp; keeping Rahane &amp; Shami on bench has &amp; will hurt India badly!
</p>

<p>
Coming from an SL fan : Dhoni's calmness is incomparable even to any of the calmest of captains this game has seen, like, steve waugh, richards, Hansie cronje, Ranatunga etc. Only insecured persons will shout out of minds during
victories as they think they dont deserve it. Even after winning as many 
world cups. this guy is all calmness. 
</p>
<p>
You can get another Sachin/Akram/Lara/warne but can never get another Dhoni
in cricket
</p>
<p>
The way he said 'Out' after that last ball without too much emotion or spice shows what this man is upto. Fans of other countries (including my fella SL fans) should just admire and enjoy such games, learn the life lesson of composure of players like Dhoni, instead of claiming 'luck' etc.
Finally almost everyone is forgetting the role played by Nehra in this game. He mentored every bowler and also guided Dhoni all the way through and that is why Dhoni respects him so much.
Its either India or Australia who will win this world cup from her.
</p>
<p>
-Kushal Veeerarathne
</p>
</p>, <p>

victories as they think they dont deserve it. Even after winning as many

</p>, <p>
You can get another Sachin/Akram/Lara/warne but can never get another Dhoni
in cricket
</p>, <p>
The way he said 'Out' after that last ball without too much emotion or spice shows what this man is upto. Fans of other countries (including my fella SL fans) should just admire and enjoy such games, learn the life lesson of composure of players like Dhoni, instead of claiming 'luck' etc.
Finally almost everyone is forgetting the role played by Nehra in this game. He mentored every bowler and also guided Dhoni all the way through and that is why Dhoni respects him so much.
Its either India or Australia who will win this world cup from her.
</p>, <p>
-Kushal Veeerarathne
